metadata.name: Potential WinAPI Calls Via PowerShell Scripts
metadata.comment: Detects use of WinAPI functions in PowerShell scripts

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('virtualalloc')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('openprocess')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('writeprocessmemory')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('createremotethread')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('openprocesstoken')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('lookupprivilegevalue')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('adjusttokenprivileges')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('openprocesstoken')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('duplicatetokenex')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('closehandle')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('writeprocessmemory')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('virtualalloc')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('readprocessmemory')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('virtualfree'))))

output.summary: Detects use of WinAPI functions in PowerShell scripts
